page.title: 08PIG FARMING.
page.content: Pinkneys Green Farm, Maidenhead is quite an old farm, some of its buildings are over 100 years old. It is chiefly an arable farm, but it does have a small herd of pigs. You can hear the noise from the three pig-sties from quite a distance. We were allowed to stroke the animals. Their noses felt wet and quivering, and their skins were very hard and bristly. The pigs often get angry and fight each other, and although their skins are very hard, they get lots of cuts. If they see blood, that makes them even angrier, so the walls of the pig-sties are painted red to hide the blood splashes. The pigs are reared on dried pig pellets, and on any waste food that the farmer can get. When they have been fattened they are then marketed for pork and bacon.
